bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 25 (Friday, February 8, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. NAPOLITANO:H.R. 1109.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8: ``The Congress shall have power tolay and collect taxes, duties, imposts and excises, to paythe debts and provide for the common defense and generalwelfare of the United States; but all duties, imposts andexcises shall be uniform throughout the United States;''[Page H1493]

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]
Del. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 1109, Mental Health Services for Students Act
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Energy and Commerce on September 9, 2020

summary.text:
Mental Health Services for Students Act of 2019

This bill provides specific statutory authority for the Project AWARE (Advancing Wellness and Resiliency in Education) State Educational Agency Grant Program that is administered by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration. The program supports school-based mental health services, including screening, treatment, and outreach programs.

Mental Health Services for Students Act of 2020

This bill provides specific statutory authority for the Project AWARE (Advancing Wellness and Resiliency in Education) State Educational Agency Grant Program that is administered by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration. The program supports school-based mental health services, including screening, treatment, and outreach programs.

bill.title: Mental Health Services for Students Act of 2020

item.title: Mental Health Services for Students Act of 2020
To amend the Public Health Service Act to revise and extend projects relating to children and to provide access to school-based comprehensive mental health programs.
Mental Health Services for Students Act of 2020

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
